text: "Well, sir," cried Caderousse, almost breathless with eager admiration, "you say you loved Valentine, that you were engaged to M.d'Épinay, for he came this morning to Paris."

passages.full_quote: "<used>Well, sir," sa</used>id Morrel, sinking into a chair, "you have heard all, and I have nothing further to tell you."
"Oh, you are a man of God, <used>sir," cried Caderousse</used>; "for no one knew that Edmond had given you this diamond, and you might have kept it."
"Ah, reverend <used>sir," cried Caderousse, c</used>lasping his hands, and drawing nearer to Monte Cristo, "I may indeed say you are my deliverer!"

passages.fragment: , '' cried Caderousse , almost breathless with eager admiration , `` you say
passages.full_quote: "And that diamo<used>nd," cried Caderousse, almost breathless with eager admiration, "you say</used>, is worth fifty thousand francs?"

passages.fragment: , `` you say you loved Valentine , that you were
passages.full_quote: "Sir," said he to Maximil<used>ian, "you say you loved Valentine, that you were</used> betrothed to her"

passages.fragment: Valentine , that you were engaged to M. d'Épinay ,
passages.full_quote: You told me, my dear <used>Valentine, that you were engaged to M.d'Épinay, a</used>nd that your father was resolved upon completing the match, and that from his will there was no appeal, as M. de Villefort was never known to change a determination once formed

passages.fragment: engaged to M. d'Épinay , for he came this morning to Paris .
passages.full_quote: But, since you say nothing remains but for M.d'Épinay to arrive that the contract may be signed, and the following day you will be his, tomorrow you will be <used>engaged to M.d'Épinay, for he came this morning to Paris</used>.
